headline: This Recession-Resistant Stock Is Up 16% This Year. Here's Why It Can Beat Trump's Tariffs.
summary: As of April 8, the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) is down 18%, the Nasdaq Composite is in a bear market, and investors are reeling over President Donald Trump's plan to impose the highest tariff rates in over a century.  Over its history, the company has delivered positive same-store sales growth in every year since 1990, except for 2021 (a same-store sales spike of 16.3% when COVID-19 hit in 2020 gave way to a decline of 2.8% the following year).
